document.docAuthor: Xingmin Wang, Hermes E. Escalona, Shunxiang Ren & Chen Xiaosheng
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic review of the ladybird genus Sticholotis from China (Coleoptera: Coccinellidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic review of the ladybird genus Sticholotis from China (Coleoptera: Coccinellidae)

heading.emphasis:
Key to the species of
Sticholotis
from China

paragraph.keyLead:
- Elytron with row of large punctures along sutural and lateral margins ( Figs 11–12 )..................
S. vietnamica Hoàng

4. Body uniformly yellow ( Fig 14 )..............................................
S. simplifulva Wang & Ren
sp. nov.

- Elytron with dark sutural margin ( Fig. 20 )..................................................
S. carinica (Gorham)

6. Head and pronotum black. Elytron with disc yellow to red and lateral margin black ( Figs 23–25 ).....
S. hoabinhensis Hoàng

- Dorsum uniformly reddish brown ( Figs 26–28 )................................
S. denticuligera Wang & Ren
sp. nov.

9. Elytra with spots elongate-oval. TL: 2.0– 2.4 mm ...............................................
S. bilineata Weise

- Elytra with irregular red patterns ( Fig. 29 ). TL: 2.27 mm ...........................
S. flammula Wang & Ren
sp. nov.

11. Elytron with six longitudinal rows of large punctures.........................................
S. confucii (Mulsant)

- Elytra without red or brown external margins................................................
S. morimotoi Kamiya

13. Pronotum red, elytron dark brown to black with two red spots ( Figs 32–33 ). Penis long and slender ( Fig. 155 ). TL: 2.24–2.87 mm , TW: 2.08–2.57 mm , TH: 1.05–1.15 mm .................................................
S. formosana Weise

- Pronotum black, elytron black with two dark red spots ( Figs 35–36 ). Penis short and stout ( Figs 160–161 ). TL: 2.27 mm , TW: 2.01 mm , TH: 1.09 mm ..............................................................
S. taiwanensis Miyatake

- Spots on elytra irregularly shaped ( Figs 38–40 ). Parameres distinctly longer than penis guide ( Figs 166–167 ). TL: 2.18–2.27 mm , TW: 1.91–2.11 mm , TH: 1.01–1.05 mm ...................................
S. wenchangia Wang & Ren
sp. nov.

15. Penis relatively longer and slender ( Figs 175 , 179 ). Additional dorsal strut-like projection on tegminal basal piece large, almost same length to strut ( Figs 176 , 180 )...................................................................... 16

- Penis relatively shorter and stouter ( Fig. 171 ). Additional dorsal strut-like projection on tegminal basal piece small, half length of strut ( Figs 172 ). TL: 2.32–2.44 mm , TW: 1.98–2.11 mm , TH: 1.05–1.19 mm .....................
S. petila Yu & Pang

16. Elytral spots medium-sized, the distance between them larger than spot diameters ( Figs 44–46 ). TL: 1.6–2.1mm , TW: 1.3–1.8 mm , TH: 0.9–1.2 mm .....................................................................
S. ruficeps Weise

- Elytral spots very large, the distance between them about 1/3 of one diameter ( Figs 47–49 ). TL: 2.70–2.90 mm , TW: 2.51–2.67 mm , TH: 1.38–1.48 mm .................................................
S. dadugangensis Wang & Ren
sp. nov.

19. Pronotum yellowish brown ( Fig. 50 ). Parameres distinctly dilated in apical third ( Figs 185–186 ). TL: 2.34 mm , TW: 2.14 mm , TH: 1.35 mm ................................................................
S. dilatata Wang & Ren
sp. nov.

- Pronotum dark brown to black ( Figs 53–55 ). Parameres not dilated ( Figs 189–190 ). TL: 2.01–2.37 mm , TW: 1.85–2.11 mm , TH: 1.19–1.35 mm ....................................................................
S. cinctipennis Weise

- Apex of elytra without spots. TL: 2.0 mm..................................................
S. klapperichi Mader

24. Elytral disc with spots very large and elongate oval ( Fig. 62 ). Elytra covered with uniformly fine punctures ( Fig. 62 ). TL: 2.14–2.21 mm , TW: 1.81–1.91 mm , TH: 1.03–1.05 mm ........................
S. magnopunctata Wang & Ren
sp. nov.

- Elytral disc with spots relatively small and rounded ( Fig. 65 ). Elytra covered with uniformly fine punctures and two rows of large punctures along margin of sutural spot ( Fig. 65 ). TL: 2.14 mm , TW: 1.88 mm , TH: 1.15 mm ...............................................................................................
S. acutifolia Wang & Ren
sp. nov.

- Anterior elytral spot not touching the basal elytral margin ( Fig. 68 ). TL: 2.11–2.47 mm , TW: 1.88–2.21 mm , TH: 1.15–1.32 mm .........................................................................
S. tortus Wang & Ren
sp. nov.

27. Pronotum yellow ( Fig 71, 73 ). Penis thick and penis guide extremely broad ( Figs 219–220 ). TL: 2.67–2.90 mm , TW: 2.37– 2.54 mm , TH: 1.19–1.38 mm ..................................................
S. latissima Wang & Ren
sp. nov.

- Pronotum dark red ( Fig. 74 ). Penis short and stout, penis guide thin ( Figs 224–225 ). TL: 2.24–2.97 mm , TW: 2.01–2.57 mm , TH: 1.19–1.62 mm .......................................................
S. maolanensis Wang & Ren
sp. nov.

29. Elytron disc and base with large and rounded spots ( Fig. 77 ). Penis very long and slender ( Fig. 228 ). Parameres slender ( Figs 229–230 ). TL: 2.08 mm , TW: 1.81 mm , TH: 1.05 mm ................................
S. tenuis Wang & Ren
sp. nov.

- Elytron disc and base with small spots ( Fig. 80 ). Penis short ( Fig. 233 ). Parameres broad ( Fig. 234–235 ). TL: 2.27–2.54 mm , TW: 2.11–2.41 mm , TH: 1.22–1.38 mm ...................................................
S. brachyloba
sp. nov.

31. Elytra with spots on humeral callus sligthly separated from basal margins ( Fig. 86 ). TL: 2.67–2.97 mm , TW: 2.54–2.84 mm , TH: 1.22–1.48 mm .............................................................
S. pengi Wang & Ren
sp. nov.

32. Elytron with spots on base and disc larger than sutural spots ( Fig. 89 ). TL: 2.80–2.90 mm , TW: 2.54–2.67 mm , TH: 1.46–1.48 mm .....................................................................
S. wuzhishana Wang & Ren
sp. nov.

- Elytron with spots on base and disc distinctly smaller than sutural spots ( Fig. 92 ). TL: 2.44 mm , TW: 2.18 mm , TH: 1.29 mm .......................................................................
S. nanlingensis Wang & Ren
sp. nov.

35. Elytron with 2 large black spots. TL: 1.75–1.9 mm , TW: 1.55–1.6 mm ............................
S. pictipennis Lewis

- Elytron with 3 relatively small black spots, although additional black streaks are present on lateral or sutural margins. TL: 2.4 mm ..............................................................................
S. maculata Korschefsky

- Elytron without spots touching basal margin or suture ( Figs 95–96 ). TL: 2.51–2.93 mm , TW: 2.24–2.60 mm , TH: 1.48–1.71 mm ....................................................................
S. octopunctata Wang & Ren
sp. nov.

37. Elytral spots not touching suture at basal 2/5. TL: 2.0– 2.26 mm , TW: 1.76–1.82 mm ( Yu 1995 )..........
S. linguiformis Yu

- Parameres very short, about 1/2 of penis guide length ( Fig. 262 ). TL: 2.41–2.80 mm , TW: 2.18–2.47 mm , TH: 1.32–1.48 mm .......................................................................
S. jinpingensis Wang & Ren
sp. nov.

39. Penis guide thin and slender, apices of parameres moderately broadening, clavate ( Fig. 267 ). TL: 2.26–2.70 mm , TW: 2.08– 2.44 mm , TH: 1.22–1.52 mm ...................................................
S. clavata Wang & Ren
sp. nov.

- Penis guide wide and short, apices of parameres not broadening ( Fig. 272 ). TL: 2.31–2.54 mm , TW: 2.08–2.34 mm , TH: 1.35– 1.42 mm .....................................................................
S. crassa Wang & Ren
sp. nov.

- Elytra reddish brown, with two large yellow irregular spots, and sixteen small black spots around their margins ( Figs 107– 109 ). TL: 2.70–2.90 mm , TW: 2.31–2.67 mm , TH: 1.42–1.45 mm .......................
S. taenia Wang & Ren
sp. nov.
41. Pronotum with two black spots before base. TL: 3.2 mm , TW: 2.65 mm ···················································· S. undeci- mpunctata Miyatake

- Spots on elytron not touching the basal margin and suture ( Figs 110–112 ). TL: 2.93–3.13 mm , TW: 2.67–2.80 mm , TH: 1.55– 1.71 mm .................................................................
S. neckiformis Wang & Ren
sp. nov.

43. Penis guide very thick at base, apex strongly curved in lateral view, and very wide in ventral view ( Figs 287–288 ). TL: 2.3 4– 2.70 mm , TW: 2.11–2.41 mm , TH: 1.12–1.25 mm ....................................
S. obesa Wang & Ren
sp. nov.

- Penis guide distinctly thiner than
S. obesa
, apex not curved, and narrow in ventral view ( Figs 292–293 ). TL: 2.47–3.07 mm , TW: 2.21–2.84 mm , TH: 1.25–1.68 mm ...........................................
S. robusta Wang & Ren
sp. nov.
